alert.note: Alert for Montgomery; Stanly (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 05 at 7:06PM EDT until July 05 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Raleigh has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Montgomery County in central North Carolina... Central Stanly County in central North Carolina... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 706 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Albemarle, Troy, Badin Lake, Plyler, Badin, Morrow Mountain State Park, Lake Tillery and Finger. This includes the following flood prone locations... Town Creek between Main St and Snuggs Rd, Quemby Mall & Delco Plaza, Memory Creek at Main St, Town Creek at Bethany Rd, Little Long Creek at Old Charlotte Rd., Long Creek at Kingsley Dr., Long Creek at W. Main St., Melchor Branch at Ridge St., Coley Branch at Corbin St. and Big Bear Creek at Old Mill Rd. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
